sentence.Network_en: We're not going to take this ( expletive ) any more.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们不能再他妈这样下去了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as an adjective): from late Latin expletivus, from explere 'fill out', from ex- 'out' + plere 'fill'. The general noun sense 'word used merely to fill out a sentence' (early 17th cent.) was applied specifically to an oath or swear word in the early 19th cent

entry.def: An expletive is a rude word or expression such as 'Damn!' which you say when you are annoyed, excited, or in pain.

means.word_mean: 1. profane or obscene expression usually of surprise or anger;
2. a word or phrase conveying no independent meaning but added to fill out a sentence or metrical line
